meanings.definition: To remove from the Christian faith.
meanings.sent1: She decided to unchristen herself after years of questioning her beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The priest warned that they would unchristen anyone who did not follow the church's teachings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child joked that he would unchristen his sister's favorite doll.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to unchristen the old church, leaving it in ruins.
meanings.sent5: The decision to unchristen the ancient cathedral sparked controversy among the townspeople.

meanings.definition: To deprive of Christian privileges or rights.
meanings.sent1: The king had the power to unchristen those who opposed his rule.
meanings.sent2: The council threatened to unchristen the nobleman if he did not pay his dues to the church.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher would unchristen any student caught cheating during the exam.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter seemed to unchristen the once flourishing garden, leaving it barren.
meanings.sent5: The decision to unchristen the town's patron saint caused uproar among the citizens.
